author: Special Correspondent
text:
Mayor V.V. Rajan Chellappa, and Commissioner Sandeep Nanduri in the newly inaugurated hospital at Sellurin Madurai on Saturday.

Chief Minister Jayalalithaa dedicated a 50-bed multi-speciality hospital built by Corporation of Madurai at Sellur here on Saturday.

Launching the new facility through video-conference from Chennai secretariat, the Chief Minister wished that the Corporation would serve the people well and provide top class healthcare.

Mayor V.V. Rajan Chellappa, Commissioner Sandeep Nanduri and others who went round the new hospital said that it has ground and first floor with a carpet area of about 14,000 square feet. There is ample space for ambulance vehicles to come inside the premises. For serious inpatients, lift was provided. For those needy patients, scan facility was available in the hospital, they said.

The Chief Minister also dedicated a newly constructed truck terminal near Mattuthavani integrated bus stand. According to a press release, the truck terminal built at a cost of Rs.six crore would facilitate truck drivers to halt on the outskirts and avoid criss-crossing into the city.

The terminal can accommodate close to 125 vehicles and it has all other facilities for the crew members, including restroom, dining among others.
title: CM dedicates multi-speciality hospital to public at Sellur
